question: My mother recently had a stent inserted into her esophageas.  She is 81, has been on oxygen therapy for over a year, has diabetes, congestive heart disease.  The only treatment offered is radiation therapy.  Surgery is not an option, chemo has been pretty much rulled out also.  There is a 3" tumor that has touched some of the lymph nodes around the area.  She said it has "tentacles" that are radiating from the area said to be between the aeota and her esophageas.My question is regarding radiation treatment and the quality of life/life expectancy she is looking at.  Thank you.
title: life expectancy with cancer on the esophageas
